page.title: 11FARMING IN FINZEAN 1985.
page.content: Farming is{mixed},now mechanised and intensive, with all{16 units}having both arable and rough grazing land. {All are family}units,enlarging as tenancies fall vacant.Crops are {silage,hay,oats,barley,turnips and {potatoes}tho'winter wheat and oil- seed rape are gaining in popularity. Most grow only sufficient for feeding and seed but barley of high quality sells to whisky distillers. In Autumn the Spring{calves}are weaned and fattened in courts{for sale}whilst the cows are put to rough grazing with supplementary feeding of silage, hay and turnips till Spring calving. Some farms stock sheep - Blackface, Suffolk and Cheviot,selling a yearly {crop of lambs.}Little poultry and only a rare dairy cow is kept now-no egg or dairy cheque to finance housekeeping.
